intro: Dimorphotheca nervosa, commonly known as the yellow oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow central disk surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Dimorphotheca nervosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
